newsitem.title: USA: Fox News costs over $150 mln in 1996-97.
newsitem.headline: Fox News costs over $150 mln in 1996-97.

text.p: The Fox News Channel launched on Monday will spend more than $150 million at start-up, with a $50 million New York City studio and operational costs of more than $100 million, a News Corp Ltd executive said.

"We have invested more than $50 million to construct (the studio), have budgeted more than $100 million and currently employ 700 people to operate the channel in 1996-1997," News Corp group general counsel Arthur Siskind said at a New York City government hearing.

Siskind also said News Corp-owned Fox News Channel, a 24-hour television service competing against two other all-news services in the United States, had leased 100,000 square feet of New York City office space through 2015 for a total rental commitment of $88 million.
Siskind made the figures public during testimony to a city government panel considering an early review of New York City franchises held by Time Warner Inc and serving 1.2 million subscribers.
Time Warner is merging with Turner Broadcasting and has refused to carry Fox News. Siskind said the merger justified early review of the Time Warner franchises.
